title: Commissions
context: §437D-8.5 Commissions. (a) No lessor or officer, employee, agent, or other representative of the lessor shall pay or receive a commission for selling damage waivers, except as provided in subsection (b). Any violation of this section shall be an unfair or deceptive act or practice as provided in section 480-2. (b) As used in this section: &ldquo;Commission for selling damage waivers&rdquo; includes any compensation, bonus, award, or remuneration that corresponds directly to the amount of sales of damage waivers. &ldquo;Commission for selling damage waivers&rdquo; does not include any compensation, bonus, award, or remuneration to an employee that corresponds to the overall gross receipts of a sales location, where sales of damage waivers are one of many factors contributing to overall gross receipts. &ldquo;Sales location&rdquo; means any location at which the employee worked or had oversight responsibility during the applicable compensation period. [L 1990, c 209, pt of §1; am L 1991, c 227, §1; am L 2003, c 155, §2; am L 2009, c 148, §7]
